extendedIngredients.name: gin
extendedIngredients.originalString: 10 ounces London dry gin, such as Spring 44

extendedIngredients.name: limes
extendedIngredients.originalString: 3/4 ounce fresh juice from about 2 limes

recipes.title: Gypsy Woman from 1534
recipes.instructions: Procedures                                                                              1                                                                            To make the tea-infused gin: Pour gin into resealable jar and add jasmine green tea bag. Infuse at room temperature for 1 hour, taste for flavor, then continue to infuse up to 2 hours more if desired, tasting every 30 minutes. Remove tea bags and reseal.                                                                                                                             2                                                                            To make the cocktail: Fill cocktail shaker with ice. Add tea-infused gin, lime juice, St. Germain, and yellow Chartreuse. Shake until well chilled, about 10 seconds.                                                                                                                            3                                                                            Double strain into chilled coupe glass. Squeeze oils from outside of lemon peel onto the drink and rub outside of peel along the glass's rim. Garnish with lemon peel.

steps.step: Pour gin into resealable jar and add jasmine green tea bag. Infuse at room temperature for 1 hour, taste for flavor, then continue to infuse up to 2 hours more if desired, tasting every 30 minutes.
To make the cocktail: Fill cocktail shaker with ice.
Add tea-infused gin, lime juice, St. Germain, and yellow Chartreuse. Shake until well chilled, about 10 seconds.
Double strain into chilled coupe glass. Squeeze oils from outside of lemon peel onto the drink and rub outside of peel along the glass's rim.
